titleStmt.title: Daniel Duggins et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5651

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency, Thos E Bramlette,
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Daniel Duggins would respectfully represent, That at the February term 1860 of the Garrard Circuit Court he was Indicted. for carrying a concealed deadly Weapon. -- That he attended at several Terms of said Court, ready and fully prepared to prove that he was justifiable in carrying said weapon (his life having been threatened upon sight) that from some cause the attorney for the Comth paid no attention to the matter, for several termes of said Court. so that your petitioner. thought and believed that the case had been dismissed, -- and lost sight of it. That at the February term 1864 the case was called and a judgment for Fifty dollars rendered agt him, -- Now your petitioner is a poor man, with a large family none of whom are able to aid him in making a living for himself & family. which taken with the fact that Two respectable farmers of the county are now and have been allways ready & willing to swear befor a court of Justice that they heard a citizen, say in a threatening manner that he intended to kill your petitioner upon sight, justifies your petitioner and the various citizens, and neighbors. to in asking your Excellency to remit said fine. July 25th 1864

W M> Romans
Jos D. Johnston
Nixon Palmer
A B Brown
Overton Terrill
Thos. Anderson
William Turner
Jno Q Dudley
M. L. Rice
Alex Sisk
Henry Suggins
B. F. Jennings
G. E. Hackley
John W Letcher
H. S. Burnam
Jas S Manson S G C
R. Hackley
Jas. N. Aldridge
S. O. Middleton
Jno. W. Dunn
Isham Burtlett
J. A. Beagley
N Sandifer
Wm Collier
B T Pheriss
J Ray
E P Walker
Marshal Ray jr
William Lusk
Alexander Holsclaver
William Comiskey
J B Arnold
T Bowin
R. L. Smith
W S Miller Jr
Cliff Anderson
James Ward
W. H. Wherritt clk Co ct
W D Hopper clk Cir. Ct.
Jas A Anderson
Coleman Hicks
L R McMurtry

Garrard Cir Ct vs D. Duggins
$50
Remtd.
29th July/64
